meanings.definition: A tool used for measuring the curvature of a surface.
meanings.sent1: The spherometer helped the scientist check the roundness of the ball.
meanings.sent2: The technician used the spherometer to determine the shape of the lens.
meanings.sent3: The spherometer and the ruler had a race to see who could measure the curve faster.
meanings.sent4: Her precision was like a spherometer, accurately gauging the smoothness of the glass.
meanings.sent5: The spherometer's three legs made it easy to measure the surface's roundness.

meanings.definition: To measure the radius of a sphere using a spherometer.
meanings.sent1: He will spherometer the ball to find its exact size.
meanings.sent2: She spherometers every marble she finds to understand its dimensions.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to spherometer the yarn ball, thinking it was a tiny planet.
meanings.sent4: His eyes spherometered the globe, trying to grasp its vastness.
meanings.sent5: The scientist spherometered the crystal ball, hoping to predict the future accurately.
